nodes.bodyText:
Also drop identity and delagate to session.
Consider leaving the non-null checks though.
Add description to non-null check for session.

Also drop identity and delagate to session.

Identity cannot be dropped as session object is not always available (e.g some GlueHiveMetastore uses DEFAULT_METASTORE_USER). In the future (once we have Glue impersonation) maybe identity can be dropped

Yeah - right.
I also noticed that there is rnn check for session already above. Drop the new one you added.
There is casting involved, so it doesn't work
This test methods tends to look to long. Consider splitting into two (possibly calling out to shared private implementation).

The test does:

writes test file
reads test file to warm-up cache and asserts counters (this ensures that cache is populated)
reads test file with cache enabled and asserts counters (this ensures that cache works)
reads test file with cache disabled via session property (this ensures that session property works)
reads test fail again with cache enabled using new FS (this ensures that cache data is not dropped)

I guess maybe 3) could be removed, but I don't think it would greatly simplify this test.

I was more thinking of having one test which does:
1,2,3. And other which is focused on session property and does 1,2,4,5. But not sure if that would be more readable.
I'm not sure there isn't some interaction between 3) and 5), so that's why I prefer keep them together

I hate this one. We are not sure that we are really testing anything. If we read from cache and stats were updated infrequently the assertions would still pass.

I know this sleep isn't great, but 1s should be more then enough and the test won't be flaky if it hiccups. I don't know how to make it better at this point.

It would be best to have jmx object which exposes last time rubix stats were updated. Can we have it?

This is probably a good idea, but it won't allow us to skip assertEventually
